name: Animals A to Z Quiz | Identify the Animal | 25 Questions

questions.text: The name of this animal is Afrikaans for 'earth pig'.
questions.explanation:
Aardvark.

	This strange animal looks like a cross between a pig, a donkey, and a kangaroo. It eats termites. The aardwolf is a strange, shy nocturnal African carnivore in the hyena family.

questions.text: This is a small nocturnal primate with very large eyes.
questions.explanation:
Bushbaby.

	They live in Africa and are related to lorises and galagos. All of the other animals listed are also primates. The bonobo is also known as the pygmy chimpanzee.

questions.text: This African cat has tufts of black hair on its ears and can jump 10 feet in the air to catch a bird.
questions.explanation:
Caracal.

	The caracal is related to lynx and bobcats but does not have spots. The coucal is a bird in the cuckoo family.

questions.text: This large marine animal is a cousin of the manatee.
questions.explanation:
Dugong.

	It's a vegetarian, also known as 'sea cow.' Duikers and dik-diks are small African antelopes.

questions.text: In winter I have a white coat but it turns dark again in the warmer months when I have a different name.
questions.explanation:
Ermine.

	A stoat's coat is dark in summer but turns white in snowy regions. In winter, the white-coloured stoat is often called an ermine though it remains a stoat. Mantles for kings were made from hundreds of weasel pelts. An echidna is a monotreme- an egg-laying mammal- and an elephant shrew is a small but mighty African insectivore.

questions.text: This imported pest causes much damage in the Southwestern U.S.
questions.explanation:
Fire ant.

	It makes above ground mounds and attacks if these are damaged.

questions.text: This is a long-necked gazelle from Africa.
questions.explanation:
Gerenuk.

	It's also called Waller's gazelle and browses like a giraffe. A gemsbok is a large antelope, and a garibaldi is a bright orange marine fish found off of the California and Mexican coast.

questions.text: This large parrot is colored a brilliant purple-blue.
questions.explanation:
Hyacinth macaw.

	It is the largest member of the parrot family and lives in South America. It is severely endangered. Hoatzin and hoopoes are also birds. The tahr is a mountain animal with similarities to both goats and antelope.

questions.text: This is the name of both a type of wasp and a type of mongoose.
questions.explanation:
Ichneumon.

	The female wasp has a long protruberance on its abdomen, called an ovipositor, with which it drills into tree trunks to lay its eggs. The iguana is a reptile, the Iberian lynx is an European wild cat, and the indigo bunting is a bird.

questions.text: This small cat resembles an otter.
questions.explanation:
Jaguarundi.

	The jaguarundi comes in red and brown phases. It lives in Central America, Mexico, and the extreme Southwest US. The jackal is a coyote-like canid and the jird is a gerbil-like rodent.

questions.text: This small African antelope has cup-shaped hooves that help it climb rocks.
questions.explanation:
Klipspringer.

	It's Dutch for 'cliff springer.' They mate for life. Kudu are very large antelope, the kinkajou is a South American mammal in the raccoon family, and a kribensis is a cichlid fish.

questions.text: This bird is known for its haunting, laughing night call.
questions.explanation:
Loon.

	The loon eats fish. Its feet are so far back on its body that it cannot really walk on land. Lyrebirds are similar to birds of paradise. Lemurs are Madagascan primates and a loris is a small primate.

questions.text: This baboon has multicolored skin- front and rear!
questions.explanation:
Mandrill.

	A slightly less colorful relative is the drill. All of the other animals are also primates but are not baboons.

questions.text: This animal has one spiral 'horn' that is actually a tooth.
questions.explanation:
Narwhal.

	This is a small toothed whale. The nilgai is an Indian antelope, the nuthatch is a small songbird, and the Nanday conure is a South American parrot.

questions.text: This animal is the most intelligent invertebrate.
questions.explanation:
Octopus.

	The octopus can solve complex problems like unscrewing a jar lid to get to the shrimp inside.

questions.text: Many people in the Eastern U.S. build large houses for this insect-eating bird.
questions.explanation:
Purple martin.

	The bird nests in large colonies. A potoo is a bird in the frogmouth family, related to nighthawks and nightingales.

questions.text: This Central American bird has brilliant green plumage.
questions.explanation:
Quetzal.

	The color can actually be washed from the feathers. A quokka is a small kangaroo, a quoll is a catlike marsupial, and a quagga is an extinct species of zebra.

questions.text: This snake-eating ground dweller is actually a member of the cuckoo family.
questions.explanation:
Roadrunner.

	It looks much more like a cuckoo than like the cartoon bird! All of the other animals are also birds.

questions.text: This Russian antelope has an inflatable nose.
questions.explanation:
Saiga.

	It filters out dust on the steppes. Sassaby and sitatunga are African antelopes.

questions.text: The closest relatives of this jungle bird are woodpeckers.
questions.explanation:
Toucan.

	The toucan's bill is hollow and very light. The other animals mentioned are also birds.

questions.text: This South American monkey has a bright red, bare face.
questions.explanation:
Uakari.

	The face is framed by a ruff of hair. A ural is a goatlike mammal.

questions.text: This Andean llama-family member produces fine wool.
questions.explanation:
Vicuna.

	The Incas herded vicunas. A volpino is a fox and a vervet is a monkey.

questions.text: This giant weasel is known for its bad temper and even worse smell.
questions.explanation:
Wolverine.

	This animal is so strong that it can drive grizzly bears from their kills! The wallaby is a small kangaroo and the whydah is an African bird.

questions.text: This long-haired animal is a Tibetan member of the cow family.
questions.explanation:
Yak.

	The yak is a domestic animal. A yapok is an opossum, the other two are birds.

questions.text: This African animal looks and smells like a skunk.
questions.explanation:
Zorilla.

	It is a great example of convergent evolution- unrelated animals that follow the same evolutionary path for the same reasons. A zorro is a fox and a zebra mussel is a mollusk.
